question: CPU scheduling is the basis of ___________
options: ['a) multiprocessor systems', 'b) multiprogramming operating systems', 'c) larger memory sized systems', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: With multiprogramming ______ is used productively
options: ['a) time', 'b) space', 'c) money', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: What are the two steps of a process execution?
options: ['a) I/O & OS Burst', 'b) CPU & I/O Burst', 'c) Memory & I/O Burst', 'd) OS & Memory Burst']

question: An I/O bound program will typically have ____________
options: ['a) a few very short CPU bursts', 'b) many very short I/O bursts', 'c) many very short CPU bursts', 'd) a few very short I/O bursts']
option1: a) a few very short CPU bursts
option2: b) many very short I/O bursts
option3: c) many very short CPU bursts
option4: d) a few very short I/O bursts

question: A process is selected from the ______ queue by the ________ scheduler, to be executed
options: ['a) blocked, short term', 'b) wait, long term', 'c) ready, short term', 'd) ready, long term']

question: In the following cases non – preemptive scheduling occurs?
options: ['a) When a process switches from the running state to the ready state', 'b) When a process goes from the running state to the waiting state', 'c) When a process switches from the waiting state to the ready state', 'd) All of the mentioned']
option1: a) When a process switches from the running state to the ready state
option2: b) When a process goes from the running state to the waiting state
option3: c) When a process switches from the waiting state to the ready state

question: The switching of the CPU from one process or thread to another is called ____________
options: ['a) process switch', 'b) task switch', 'c) context switch', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: What is Dispatch latency?
options: ['a) the speed of dispatching a process from running to the ready state', 'b) the time of dispatching a process from running to ready state and keeping the CPU idle', 'c) the time to stop one process and start running another one', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the speed of dispatching a process from running to the ready state
option2: b) the time of dispatching a process from running to ready state and keeping the CPU idle
option3: c) the time to stop one process and start running another one

question: Scheduling is done so as to ____________
options: ['a) increase CPU utilization', 'b) decrease CPU utilization', 'c) keep the CPU more idle', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) keep the CPU more idle

question: Scheduling is done so as to ____________
options: ['a) increase the throughput', 'b) decrease the throughput', 'c) increase the duration of a specific amount of work', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) increase the duration of a specific amount of work

question: What is Turnaround time?
options: ['a) the total waiting time for a process to finish execution', 'b) the total time spent in the ready queue', 'c) the total time spent in the running queue', 'd) the total time from the completion till the submission of a process']
option1: a) the total waiting time for a process to finish execution
option2: b) the total time spent in the ready queue
option3: c) the total time spent in the running queue
option4: d) the total time from the completion till the submission of a process

question: Scheduling is done so as to ____________
options: ['a) increase the turnaround time', 'b) decrease the turnaround time', 'c) keep the turnaround time same', 'd) there is no relation between scheduling and turnaround time']
option3: c) keep the turnaround time same
option4: d) there is no relation between scheduling and turnaround time

question: What is Waiting time?
options: ['a) the total time in the blocked and waiting queues', 'b) the total time spent in the ready queue', 'c) the total time spent in the running queue', 'd) the total time from the completion till the submission of a process']
option1: a) the total time in the blocked and waiting queues
option2: b) the total time spent in the ready queue
option3: c) the total time spent in the running queue
option4: d) the total time from the completion till the submission of a process

question: Scheduling is done so as to ____________
options: ['a) increase the waiting time', 'b) keep the waiting time the same', 'c) decrease the waiting time', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) keep the waiting time the same

question: What is Response time?
options: ['a) the total time taken from the submission time till the completion time', 'b) the total time taken from the submission time till the first response is produced', 'c) the total time taken from submission time till the response is output', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the total time taken from the submission time till the completion time
option2: b) the total time taken from the submission time till the first response is produced
option3: c) the total time taken from submission time till the response is output
